The Matrix (1999)

93
Your Score
Excellent(Tier 10)
Your Rating
500 characters left
Link to Full Review
Links Must Be To Criticker's Full Reviews Forum
Edit Score - Delete Score
Ranked on December 18th, 2009

After meeting a group of rebels, a computer hacker who goes by the codename Neo learns that reality is not what it appears to be.

More Film Information and Actions

Genres: Sci-fi, Suspense/Thriller, Action, Adventure

Franchise: The Matrix

Country: Australia, USA

Directed By: Lilly Wachowski, Lana Wachowski

Written By: Lilly Wachowski, Lana Wachowski

Starring: Joe Pantoliano, Laurence Fishburne, Hugo Weaving, Keanu Reeves, Paul Goddard, Belinda McClory, Carrie-Anne Moss, Julian Arahanga, Marcus Chong, Gloria Foster, Anthony Ray Parker, Matt Doran

Additional Information & Actions

Type: Public | Private | Hidden

Public Collections are those which any user at Criticker can add titles to. You can moderate the collection and ban specific users from adding to it.

Private Collections are viewable by other users of Criticker, but can only be added to by yourself.

Matrix is the line you can call a movie sci-fi or not. This was outstanding.
2.0210 donnishark
95T10
An unforgettable classic that inspired a generation of filmmakers - and a generation of movie-goers. Hugely entertaining and with a brilliantly executed plot, it doesn't get any better than this as far as late 20th century sci-fi goes.

85T10
Interesting story brought to life with excellent special effects and pretty good acting from Fishburne and Keanu Reeves. This film raised the bar for action sci-fi films.

I was really impressed by it at first. Now that I see all the plot holes, it's not that impressive anymore. But still a solid movie, and inevitably a classic. I refuse to acnowledge the existence of sequels.
2.1643 Magb
80T7
The sequels have succeeded in lowering my opinion of the original, bringing all its worst elements to the front of my mind. Some of the stuff that seemed so profound at the time has lost its power after seeing what the Wachowskis' intentions apparently were all along. But The Matrix is still a very good action/sci-fi movie and it will surely be remembered for many years to come.

89T10
One of the more thought-provoking sci-fi titles, Matrix does it in superb style with intense action, generaly good (although sometimes a bit cliche) philosophy and a very fitting soundtrack. The acting is indeed bad on some occasions, especially from Keanu Reeves, but doesn't really harm the movie. I also missed some depper relationship and philosophical progression (although the movie definately makes you think), and it's really sad that next 2 movies just fell in quality for me.

96T10
One of the most original and outrageous plots ever attempted but yet it seems completely feasible and believable. The gravity defying, slow motion fight scenes are now an iconic part of cinema history. It is no stretch to say this was a groundbreaking movie.
2.2713 CosmicMonkey
90T10
The Action is so incredible and bad-ass, but the film is nowhere near as deep or as intelligent as most people think it is. The concept is ripped off of PKD short stories. The pseudo-philosophy is just pop-psycho babble and the film could have had much more social commentary. (You can choose the Red Pill or Blue Pill: The reality or the illusion. But I'd take the Purple Pill: The Reality IN the Illusion.) Still, this film did redefine the modern action scene, for a very good reason.
2.2716 Mist600
92T10
If only Keanu could act this might be a nailed on modern classic. His contemporaries: DiCaprio, Pitt and Depp couldn't help being tagged as pretty boys either but they all made real efforts to go beyond their looks and turn in varied interesting performances. Imagine Johnny Lee Millar, Matt Damon, Jude Law, Ewan McGregor - any attractive lead (1999 actor that could act!) in this role and the film would be even better than it is.

na GrahamJ
79T4
Good but overrated. The philosphy-bable is not as complex or mindblowing as fans sometimes act like. Martial Arts inspired action scenes are great fun though. Use of Blue/Green filters to differentiate real from fake worlds is well implimented, much more so than when the more unsubtle sequels used them. Keanu Reeves is rather dull (big surprise). A competant action film, well acted with good effects. Not too much more.
na Obidy
8T5
Oh, Matrix. I remember when you were a fun popcorn movie with a solidly thoughtful core, and not an exercise in pretentiousness. Keanu Reeves is appropriately bland for his role, but the rest of the cast makes up for it, and the Wachowski Brothers do a good job. It loses momentum in the ending action climax, but overall, this is a really fun movie. Just stay away from the sequels though.

na PierreTheron
40T2
A less engaging, less visually intensive, less subtle and less philosophical incarnation of Dark City. The coincidences and parallels have been done to death, but even once you go beyond Dark City, The Matrix still leaves you with sub-par nabs of John Woo trademarks and Gordon Liu fist-fights. The film lacks character, and its grungy environments aren't terribly inspired. It's entertaining on a basic level, but dull otherwise. Watch Dark City if you wanted the depth, The Killer for action.
na Dizzle
90T8
In all honesty, science fiction doesn't get much better than this. Lackluster, unnecessary sequels aside, The Matrix is easily one of the most entertaining, eye-popping and thought-provoking movies of the 90s, without a question. From start to finish, it's outlandish, engrossing plot, spot-on direction and a surprising career turn from Keanu Reeves make this film as revolutionary as it is.

100
The Matrix will blow your mind. This film is one of the first masterpieces to use more than 30 cameras to take one continuous scene. The acting might not be that great but the idea is very original and multi-faced. This is a must see film that will be an example for generations of films to come.
na davisty69
91T10

na LibertyLion
90T8
The high-concept story is highly intriguing and entertaining. It's definitely worth paying attention through all the exposition in this film, as it makes the whole experience far more rewarding. Renowned for its revolutionary cinematography, this film delivers highly in the story and action department. The protagonist could perhaps have been fleshed-out a little more, but this film still delivers, big-time. You've already seen it, but see it again.
na stevekimes
90T9
An intense film, with interesting thought and some intense action.
na misterlizard
85T10
Beautifully made and very stylish; the effects and cinematography make it seems like a graphic novel brought to life (more than most films based on graphic novels do). It tries very hard to be cool and just about manages it. Even today the effects are still some of the best ever seen. Only downside is the plot which makes no sense at all. Humans as a power source is a supremely stupid idea that anyone with the slightest grasp of high school science must laugh at.
na Vitor Barros
100T10

They tried to build a computer-game aesthetic, something that could've been interesting, but they didn't really delve into it and it ended up looking like a bad parody (especially the fighting scenes), which is almost entertaining, but the melodramatic acting and gestures kills it.

na KasperL
98T10
Iconic. The supporting characters are particularly unforgettable: Weaving's Agent Smith, Fishburne's Morpheus, The Pants' Cypher and Foster's Oracle is the stuff of legend. Thematically, it's the paranoid skeptic's wet dream. Part sci-fi pastiche, part revolutionary action cinema, 'The Matrix' is equally fascinating for its dense references and its groundbreaking visuals. And, to my mind, it hasn't dated in the decade and a half since it came out. It remains as cool and as entertaining as ever.

na Judgewestenn
85T8
The film doesn't make very much sense, the plot and characters are stale, and the scene where Trinity brings Neo back to life with her love; give me a break. Despite all of this, the film is still very enjoyable to watch (overall). I don't know if you'd call it a guilty pleasure or whatnot, but I enjoy watching it every once in a while.

A cool film that's highly entertaining, but it's not much more than that.
na LookJabba...
9T10
The Matrix is a pioneering piece of filmmaking and one of the coolest and best science fiction experiences of all time. I remember seeing the first trailer that simply said 'What Is The Matrix?' And from that moment I knew this film was going to be special. It's just a huge shame it spawned two poor sequels. Keanu, Fishburne & Moss give mediocre performances at best but Weaving is a great villain. But the real star of this film is the breathtaking visuals that set the standard for a long time.
